definition: to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: In fact, no pigeon-holing is my mood.
sentences.chinese: 其實，無須對號入座的是我的心情。

sentences.english: When the boss makes general and negative comments, don’t take it personally.
sentences.chinese: 當老闆進行泛泛的批評時，不要對號入座。

sentences.english: Please take your ticket and find your seat.
sentences.chinese: 請您攜帶入場券，對號入座。

sentences.english: The staff members asked the audience to sit in the right seats.
sentences.chinese: 工作人員要求觀衆對號入座。

sentences.english: Try not to take a study and compare it to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 不要看了一篇研究就拿自己對號入座。

sentences.english: The story I told was completely made-up, you shouldn't try to tell it to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我說的這個故事創意純屬虛構，大家不要對號入座。

definition: to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
derogatory sense/negative connotation
ambiguity/several possible meanings
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to talk rubbish
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
mistake/to make a mistake/to blunder/mistaken
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to digress/to stray from the subject
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
incorrectly written or mispronounced characters
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
